sentences.sContent: Only four years later, the first steamship crossed the Atlantic Ocean.
sentences.sContent_eng: Only four years later, the first steamship crossed the Atlantic Ocean.
sentences.sCn: 仅仅四年之后，第一艘蒸汽船横渡了大西洋。

sentences.sContent: If junk-borne shipments of wheat increased along with the expansion of railway and steamship carriage, the overall argument about the survival and growth of the junk trade is greatly strengthened.
sentences.sContent_eng: If junk-borne shipments of wheat increased along with the expansion of railway and steamship carriage, the overall argument about the survival and growth of the junk trade is greatly strengthened.
sentences.sCn: 如果经营小麦的舢板运输随着铁路、火轮船运输的扩张而增长的话，那么所有关于舢板贸易幸存和成长的论点都将得到加强。

sentences.sContent: The first development in modern transportation was the steamship.
sentences.sContent_eng: The first development in modern transportation was the steamship.
sentences.sCn: 现代交通工具的首次飞跃是轮船。

words.tran: 蒸汽的；雾重的，潮湿的；充满蒸汽的

trans.tranOther: a large ship that uses steam to produce power
